subject: Please vet this modified CC license for uploading FoF music to non-free (was: Re: Could you please forward this proposed license to Teosto?)
body:

Dear debian-legal,

The license is below.  Is it good enough for Tommi Inkila's FoF music
to be uploaded to non-free?


== How it was made ==

Tommi mailed me privately, and told me he and his teammates
would prefer that the license allow use of the music in FoF only, not
in derivatives.  I tried to convince him why allowing forking is good,
and he understands, but he still prefers to keep it this way for now.
So I think we should try to get the upstream music in Debian as-is for
now instead of bothering upstream more.  If someone wants to fork FoF
and use the upstream music, they should take it up with upstream
themselves.

So, I took http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nd-nc/1.0/legalcode
and made some changes.  For example, I changed "Creative Commons Legal
Code" to "Restricted Media Legal Code".  I didn't use the name "Frets
on Fire" there since I don't want people to think the license applies
to the whole game.  It is only for Tommi Inkila's music.  As another
example, I removed the trademark-related text.  I hereby release the
new license text to the public domain.  A diff of the original and new
licenses, and a paste of the new license in its entirety, follow.

And so I ask you, dear debian-legal: Is the new license good enough
for Tommi Inkila's FoF music to be uploaded to non-free?  If it's OK,
then we can kindly ask upstream to look over it themselves then send
it to Teosto for approval.

Regards,
Jason
